title: Related Resources
content:
Software There are many good software codes for semidefinite programming. Among the most well-known, the following ones are presented:
SeDuMi, originally by Jos Sturm, now being maintained by the optimization group at McMaster University SDPT3, by Kim-Chuan Toh, Reha Tütüncü, and Mike Todd SDPA, by the research group of Masakazu Kojima CSDP, by Brian Borchers SDP software, by various authors A very convenient way of using these (and other) SDP solvers under MATLAB® is through the YALMIP Parser/Solver by Johan Löfberg.
